actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-658, by Mr. Bonior.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 1465. Upon the adoption of this resolution, it shall be in order to consider the conference report, and all points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived. The conference report will be considered as read when called up for consideration.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 143.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by recorded vote: 281 - 82 (Roll no. 319).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against the conference report on the bill (H.R. 1465) to establish limitation on liability for damages resulting from oil pollution, to establish a fund for the payment of compensation for such damages, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 1465 (oil pollution liability) and waives all points of order against the consideration of the conference report.

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against the conference report on the bill (H.R. 1465) to establish limitation on liability for damages resulting from oil pollution, to establish a fund for the payment of compensation for such damages, and for other purposes.
